items.title: 'Hades II' Is Coming to Nintendo Switch This Month
items.summary: Nintendo made a slew of announcements during its latest Direct event, including details on a new Resident Evil game, a Ditto-centric PokÃ©mon title, and more details on Hades II.

items.title: I'm A Vegan Food Editor & This Is Officially The Best Dairy-Free Yogurt I've Tried
items.summary: Tangy AND thick, just how it should be.

items.title: Norrie gives GB lead over Poland in Davis Cup
items.summary: Cameron Norrie survives a scare against world number 545 Tomasz Berkieta to give Great Britain a 1-0 lead over Poland in the Davis Cup.

items.title: Have you gotten this year's COVID vaccine?
items.summary: Federal guidance about the 2025-2026 COVID-19 vaccine has raised questions and confusion around the shots. Have you tried to get one this year?

items.title: Philipsen beats Pedersen to win stage 19 of Vuelta
items.summary: Belgium's Jasper Philipsen wins stage 19 of the Vuelta a Espana in an uphill bunch sprint as Jonas Vingegaard increases his lead in the general classification.

items.title: Rodgers calls for 'cowardly' insider to leave Celtic
items.summary: Brendan Rodgers calls for a club investigation to uncover the "cowardly" insider who briefed against the Celtic boss to a national newspaper.

items.title: Rodgers calls for 'cowardly' insider to leave Celtic
items.summary: Brendan Rodgers calls for a club investigation to uncover the "cowardly" insider who briefed against the Celtic boss to a national newspaper.

items.title: Palace boss Glasner 'never threatened' to resign over Guehi
items.summary: Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner says "he never threatened to leave" the club over the potential sale of captain Marc Guehi to Liverpool on transfer deadline day.

items.title: Canelo v Crawford - all you need to know
items.summary: All you need to know about Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez's fight with Terence Crawford in Las Vegas.

items.title: 133-cap Ireland and Lions scrum-half Murray retires
items.summary: Former Ireland and British and Irish Lions scrum-half Conor Murray confirms his retirement from rugby after opting against a move abroad.

items.title: 'A win will make me one of the greatest of all time'
items.summary: Terence Crawford speaks to BBC Sport before his fight with Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez in Las Vegas.

items.title: Camera trap in Chile detects strange lights blazing through the wilderness. Researchers are scrambling to explain them.
items.summary: Camera trap in Chile detects strange lights blazing through the wilderness. Researchers are scrambling to explain them.

items.title: Astronomers accidentally use rare 'double zoom' technique to view black hole's corona in unprecedented detail
items.summary: For the first time, astronomers have directly measured a solar-system-size corona around a distant supermassive black hole, thanks to a rare cosmic alignment.

items.title: 'Almost like science fiction': European ant is the first known animal to clone members of another species
items.summary: A species of ant found scurrying across southern Europe is the first animal found that clones males of another species.

items.title: Full-back Lewis extends Man City deal until 2030
items.summary: Manchester City full-back Rico Lewis signs a new contract that will keep him at the club until the summer of 2030.

items.title: Pereira to become youngest woman to fight in UFC
items.summary: Brazil's Alice Pereira, 19, is set to become the youngest woman in history to fight in the UFC when she faces Montserrat Rendon at UFC Noche on Saturday.

items.title: Nintendo Drops Surprise Trailer for New â€˜Super Mario Galaxy Movieâ€™
items.summary: The Super Mario Bros. Movie sequel, titled The Super Mario Galaxy Movie, will be released in 2026. The original cast, including Chris Pratt, Anya Taylor-Joy, and Jack Black, will reprise their roles.

items.title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
items.summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

items.title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah
items.summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

items.title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
items.summary: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.

items.title: How Hampton overcame odds to become England's number one
items.summary: Hannah Hampton on overcoming a serious eye condition to rise to become England's number one goalkeeper at Euro 2025.

items.title: Why 'best-dressed officials' are missing from Wimbledon
items.summary: Wimbledon is without line judges for the first time - will 'sport's best dressed officials' be missed?
